name: Caterpie
flavorText: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

name: Metapod
flavorText: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Pineco
flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

name: Seedot
flavorText: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Nuzleaf
flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

name: Shiftry
flavorText: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Grass Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Roselia
flavorText: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Roserade
flavorText: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Maractus
flavorText: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, flip 6 coins instead of 2 for this Pokémon's Prickly Needles attack.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Charizard-EX
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Charizard-EX
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.

name: M Charizard-EX
Attack1Text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Rapidash
flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Torkoal
flavorText: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Fletchinder
flavorText: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Litleo
flavorText: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

name: Litleo
flavorText: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

name: Pyroar
flavorText: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon.
Attack1Text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Qwilfish
flavorText: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Feebas
flavorText: It eats anything, so it can even live in polluted streams and lakes. No one pays any attention to it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Milotic
flavorText: Milotic is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it are said to forget their combative spirits.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, attach 3 basic Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX).

name: Spheal
flavorText: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy they clap fins.

name: Sealeo
flavorText: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.
Attack1Text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Walrein
flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: This attack does 120 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Luvdisc
flavorText: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't draw a card at the beginning of his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Draw a card.

name: Buizel
flavorText: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Attack1Text: Shuffle 3 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Bergmite
flavorText: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Avalugg
flavorText: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
Attack2Text: This attack does 40 damage times the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken.

name: Luxray
flavorText: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey–even those taking shelter behind a wall.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Magnezone-EX
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Helioptile
flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Duskull
flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.
Attack1Text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench.
Attack2Text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Dusclops
flavorText: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Dusknoir
flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Put damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon equal to the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

name: Toxicroak-EX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Espurr
flavorText: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Meowstic
flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
Attack1Text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Skrelp
flavorText: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Geodude
flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

name: Graveler
flavorText: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

name: Golem
flavorText: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

name: Binacle
flavorText: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Barbaracle
flavorText: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
Attack1Text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.
Attack2Text: Your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Weavile
flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Stunky
flavorText: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Stunky
flavorText: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Skuntank
flavorText: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Sandile
flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Krokorok
flavorText: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

name: Scraggy
flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling it skin up to its neck.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Scrafty
flavorText: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Forretress
flavorText: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

name: Durant
flavorText: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
Attack1Text: Discard cards from your opponent's hand at random until he or she has 4 cards in his or her hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

name: Floette
flavorText: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
Ability1Text: Each of your Grass Pokémon in play gets +20 HP.

name: Floette
flavorText: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Florges
flavorText: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Spritzee
flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Carbink
flavorText: Born from temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fairy Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: M Charizard-EX
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

name: Druddigon
flavorText: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Dragalge
flavorText: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
Ability1Text: Your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon can't retreat.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Goomy
flavorText: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Sliggoo
flavorText: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Goodra
flavorText: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Pidgey
flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Pidgeotto
flavorText: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Pidgeot
flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Strong Gust attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Kangaskhan-EX
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: M Kangaskhan-EX
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon is Asleep, flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, this Pokémon is still Asleep.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Sentret
flavorText: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.

name: Furret
flavorText: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Discard the other cards.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Miltank
flavorText: If it is around babies, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.
Attack1Text: If you have any Stage 2 Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Buneary
flavorText: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Lopunny
flavorText: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Fletchling
flavorText: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

name: Furfrou
flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Charizard-EX
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Magnezone-EX
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Toxicroak-EX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Kangaskhan-EX
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: M Charizard-EX
Attack1Text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

name: M Charizard-EX
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

name: M Kangaskhan-EX
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
